programme.title: Men's Canoe (C1) Semi-Final & Final | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Men's Semi-Final and Final took place at Nautical St - White water, France, on 29/07/24. Nicolas Gestin (FRA) won Gold with a time of 91.36 seconds, Adam Burgess (GBR) won Silver, and Matej Benus (SVK) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's Kayak (K1) Semi-Final & Final | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Kayak (K1) Semifinal and Final took place at Nautical St - White Water, on 28/07/24. The Australian Jessica Fox won the Gold with a time of 96.08 seconds. Klaudia Zwolinska (POL) won the Silver, and Kimberley Woods (GBR) won the Bronze Medal.

programme.title: Single Sculls, Eights Finals | Rowing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Men and Women's Rowing Single Sculls and Eights Finals took place on 03/08/2024 Nautical Stadium - Flat Water.
At the Women's Single Sculls Final, Karolien Florijn (NED) claimed the Gold medal, Emma Twigg (NZL) took the Silver, and the Bronze went to Viktorija Senkute (LTU).
At the Men's Single Sculls Final, Oliver Zeidler (GER) won the Gold, Yauheni Zalaty (AIN) took the Silver, while Simon van Dorp (NED) claimed the Bronze medal.
At the Women's Eights Final, it was Gold for Team Romania, Silver for Team Netherlands and Bronze for Team Great Britain.
At the Men's Eights Final, the Gold went to Team Great Britain, the Silver to Team Netherlands and the Bronze to Team USA.

programme.title: The Tech Race | Episode 8
programme.desc: In this episode: table tennis robot trainers, boxing trackers, regenerative clothing, cycling smart glasses, aerodynamic sails, and football goal control.

programme.title: Men's Kayak (K1) Semi-Final & Final | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Men's Layak K1 Final took place on day six of the Olympic Games Paris 2024 at Stade d'eau vive Vaires-sur-Marne on August 1, 2024 in Paris, France.
Giovanni de Gennaro (ITA) won first place, Titouan Castryck (FRA) won second place and Pau Echaniz (ESP) took third place.

programme.title: Teresa Portela Olympic longevity makes her a legend | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Marked by determination, Teresa Portela's journey unfolds over six Olympics. From Rio to Tokyo, Portela's pursuit of Olympic glory was balanced between being an elite athlete and the joys of motherhood. In Tokyo, she finally won a long-awaited medal by bringing home silver in the K-1 200 canoe sprint event. Now training for Paris 2024, she will become the first Spanish woman to compete in seven Olympic Games.

programme.title: Women's Canoe (C1) Semi-Final & Final | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This session includes the Semi-Finals for Women's Canoe Slalom . The races took place at Nautical St. White Water, Paris, on 31/07/24.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Rower: Does Martin have the strongest legs of any Olympian?
programme.desc: The Croatian double Olympic Silver medallist Damir Martin exhibits outstanding strength and endurance.

programme.title: Single Sculls, Lightweight Double Sculls, Quadruple Sculls, Pairs | Rowing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session includes the Finals for the Lightweight Men's Double Sculls Final C, the Lightweight Women's Double Sculls Final C, the Men's Single Sculls Semi-Finals, the Women's Single Sculls Semi-Final, Women's Single Sculls Semi-Final, the Men's Pair Semi-Final , the Women's Pair Semi-Final and the Men's and Women's Quadruple Sculls Finals. The races took place at Vaires-Sur-Marne Nautical Stadium on 31/07/24.
The Men's Quadruple Sculls Finals medals went to Netherlands(Gold), Italy(Silver) and Poland(Bronze), The Women's Quadruple Sculls Final was won by Great Britain (Gold), Netherlands (Silver) and Germany(Bronze).

programme.title: Anatomy of a Rower: Does Martin have the strongest legs of any Olympian?
programme.desc: The Croatian double Olympic Silver medallist Damir Martin exhibits outstanding strength and endurance.

programme.title: Double Sculls, Fours, Eights, Single Sculls | Rowing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session took place at Nautical St - Flat Water, France, on 01/08/24.
At the Women's Double Sculls Final, Gold was claimed by Team New Zealand, Team Romania won Silver, and the Bronze went to Team Great Britain.
At the Men's Double Sculls Final, Team Romania won Gold, Team Netherlands calimed Silver, and Team Ireland completed the podium, with the Bronze.
At the Women's Four Final, it was Gold for Team Netherlands, Silver for Great Britain, and Bronze for New Zealand.
At the Men's Four Final, Gold was claimed by Team USA, the Silver by Team New Zealand, and the Bronze by Team Great Britain.

programme.title: Pairs, Lightweight Double Sculls, Single Sculls | Rowing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session took place at Nautical St - Flat Water, France, on 02/08/24.
At the Men's Pairs Final, Croatia won the Gold, Great Britain took the Silver, and Switzerland claimed the Bronze medal.
At the Women's Pairs Final, it was Gold for Netherlands, Silver for Romania and Bronze for Australia.
At the Men's Lightweight Double Sculls Final, Gold was claimed by Team Ireland, Silver by Team Italy and Bronze by Team Greece.
Finally, at the Women's Lightweight Double Sculls Final, Team Great Britain won the Gold medal, the Silver was claimed by Team Ireland, and the Bronze by Team Greece.

programme.title: Single Sculls, Eights Finals | Rowing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Men and Women's Rowing Single Sculls and Eights Finals took place on 03/08/2024 Nautical Stadium - Flat Water.
At the Women's Single Sculls Final, Karolien Florijn (NED) claimed the Gold medal, Emma Twigg (NZL) took the Silver, and the Bronze went to Viktorija Senkute (LTU).
At the Men's Single Sculls Final, Oliver Zeidler (GER) won the Gold, Yauheni Zalaty (AIN) took the Silver, while Simon van Dorp (NED) claimed the Bronze medal.
At the Women's Eights Final, it was Gold for Team Romania, Silver for Team Netherlands and Bronze for Team Great Britain.
At the Men's Eights Final, the Gold went to Team Great Britain, the Silver to Team Netherlands and the Bronze to Team USA.

programme.title: Women's & Men's Kayak Cross Quarter, Semifinals and Finals | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session includes the Women's & Men's Kayak Cross Finals. The races took place at Nautical St. White Water, Paris, on 05/08/24.
In Men's Kayak Finn Butcher (NZL) won the Gold medal, Joseph Clarke (GBR) Silver and Noah Hegge (GER) completed the podium.
In Women's Kayak Noemie Fox (AUS) won Gold, Angele Hug (FRA) Silver and Kimberley Woods (GBR) Bronze.

programme.title: Single Sculls, Pairs, Lightweight Double Sculls, Quadruple Sculls, Eights | Rowing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This session took place at Nautical St - Flat Water, France, on 29/07/24.

programme.title: Eventing Jumping Team & Individual | Equestrian | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Eventing Jumping Team & Individual took place at Chateau de Versailles, Versailles, on 29/07/24.
In the Eventing Team Final, Great Britain won the Gold, France won Silver, and Japan completed the podium.
In the Eventing Individual Final, Michael Jung (GER) won the Gold Medal, Christopher Burton (AUS) won the Silver Medal, and Laura Collet (GBR) won Bronze.

programme.title: Women's 10m Air Rifle Finals | Shooting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 10m Air Rifle Final took place at Chateauroux, France, on the 29/07/24. Hyojin Ban (KOR) won Gold with a total of 251.8. Yuting Huang (CHN) won Silver, and Audrey Gogniat (SUI) completed the podium.

programme.title: India’s Top Pistol Shooter Manu Bakher | Jee Jan Se
programme.desc: Throughout her childhood and teenage years, Manu Bakher switched sports half a dozen times. When she started practicing air pistol shooting, she knew this was the one for her. This is her amazing story.

programme.title: Shooting vs Cricket with Manu Bhaker and Smriti Mandhana | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: What happens in the battle of precision between cricket and shooting? The challenge is on, as Smriti Mandhana and Manu Bhaker swap the pistols and bats.

programme.title: Men's Synchronised 10m Platform | Diving | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Men's Synchonised 10m Platform Final took place at the Aquatics Centre, on 29/07/24. Lian/Yang (CHN) won Gold, Daley/Williams (GBR) won Silver, and Wiens/Zsombor-Murray (CAN) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's Team Final | Artistic Gymnastics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Team Final took place at the Bercy Arena, Paris, on 29/07/24. Team Japan won Gold, People's Republic of China won Silver, and the United States of America finished the podium.

programme.title: What moves me | Samir Ait Said: Finding strength in pain
programme.desc: Samir Ait Said, French artistic gymnast, suffered a severe leg injury at Rio 2016. Through a difficult comeback, while also dealing with the loss of his father, he shares the emotional journey he has been on in the last four years. From long rehabilitation to a painful mourning, he never gave up his Olympic dream and managed to find strength from his pain.

programme.title: It’s Not All Work
programme.desc: The off-season allows a brief break from gymnastics for Angelina. Training intensifies for a fired-up Morgan, while Yile reaches breaking point.

programme.title: Men's Cross-Country | Cycling Mountain Bike | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Men's Cross-Country Final at Elancourt Hill, Paris, on 29/07/24. Thomas Pidcock (GBR) claimed the Gold, Victor Koretzky (FRA) the Silver, and Alan Hatherly (RSA) the Bronze.

programme.title: Matteo Zurloni Italy’s world champion climbs to the top | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Dive into the remarkable journey of Matteo Zurloni, from small town dreamer to Olympic contender. He won the speed event at the 2023 IFSC Climbing World Championships and earning a shot at Olympic glory. Follow his ascent from humble beginnings to the dizzying heights of international competition, where every climb is a test of skill, courage, and the relentless pursuit of excellence.

programme.title: Men's Team Gold Medal Match KOR - FRA | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Men's Team Gold Medal Match took place at Invalides, Paris, on 29/07/24. The Republic of Korea won the Gold Medal with a victory over France, who won Silver, 5:1

programme.title: How India’s top archer Deepika Kumari refused to give up
programme.desc: The incredible journey of India’s top archer from a childhood born in poverty to competing on the world’s highest stages. Though Rio ultimately ended in disappointment for Kumari, she’s not done yet.

programme.title: Nikoloz: The judo World Champion from two nations | The Starting Line
programme.desc: When Nikoloz Sherazadishvili’s family moved him from Georgia to Spain at a young age, his father instilled a love of judo in him. He quickly felt at home at the local club of Brunete, in the outskirt of Madrid, where everything started with his first coach Quino Ruiz. As he gears up for his second Olympics, surrounded by his family and friends, he’s competing on the mat for Spain but also holding Georgia and the memory of his father close to his heart.

programme.title: Men's Canoe (C1) Semi-Final & Final | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Men's Semi-Final and Final took place at Nautical St - White water, France, on 29/07/24. Nicolas Gestin (FRA) won Gold with a time of 91.36 seconds, Adam Burgess (GBR) won Silver, and Matej Benus (SVK) completed the podium.

programme.title: Semi-Finals & Finals - Day 14 | Canoe Sprint | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session contains the Women's Canoe and Kayak Doubles 500m Semi-Finals and Finals, the Men's Kayak Double 500m Semi-Finals and Finals and the Men's Canoe Single 1000m Semi-Finals and Finals which took place at the Vaires-Sur-Marne Nautical Stadium on 09/08/24.
The Women's Canoe Double 500m Final was won by Xu /Sun (CHN) with Gold, Luzan/Rybachok (UKR) took silver and Mackenzie/Vincent (CAN) with Bronze.
The Women's Kayak Double 500m Final was won by Carrington/Hoskin (NZL) with Gold, Csipes/Gazso (HUN) with Silver and a tie in Bronze for Paulina Paszek/Julie Marie Hake (GER) and Pupp/Fojt (HUN).
The Men's Kayak Double 500m Final was won by Schopf/Lemke (GER) with Gold, Bence Nadas/Totka (HUN) with Silver and Van Der Westhuyzen/Green (AUS) with Bronze.
The Men's Canoe Single 1000m Final was won by Martin Fuksa (CZE) with Gold, Isaquias Queiroz (BRA) with Silver and Serghei Tarnovschi (MDA) with Bronze.
